title: Why Does Metal Have To Be So Loud?

media:group.media:title: Why Does Metal Have To Be So Loud?
media:group.media:description:
Metal has always been one of my favorite genres, and like most metalheads, I've never listened to it quietly. Turning the volume down on a brutal metal riff feels almost sacrilegious, like it's disrespectful to the music to hear it at anything but full volume. But why? Many genres can be enjoyed perfectly fine at a nice, comfortably quiet level, but metal resists that, and metalheads reject those efforts. So what's going on? Why does metal only work when it's loud as hell?

0:00 Intro
0:41 Fletcher-Munson Curve
4:04 Listener Collapse
7:33 Imagined Loudness
10:46 Noise Occupation
